column5: If LCBO go on Strike the 26th will the Beer Stores still be open? And are there any stores not LCBO that sell liquor in Thunder Bay/ Ignace area?
Beer stores will still be open but I'm 98% positive that the lcbo is the only place to buy hard stuff.

You can order online and they will ship, for free above $50 or $100 I think, ASSUMING where you are going has an address that can be shipped to. Because of the strike threat, they have a deadline for ship orders of June 19th, four days from now.

If you can, just bring it with you and pay the duty. Keep your receipts when you buy it. Cheaper anyway. If your not way over the limit they may not have you pay the duty anyway. That's my experience.

I would assume that the "agency" LCBOs would stay open. These are usually smaller LCBO outlets inside other stores. The grocery store in Nestor Falls, for example, is an agency LCBO.But a strike may dry up supplies to these agencies, especially if truckers, etc honor the picket line.Yet another reason to invade Ontario.
